page.title: 09RELIGION - ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: The church in South Cave is mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The vicar of All Saints Church is The Rev. Shimwell. The first church on this site was built before 1081 and there are still remains of a Saxon wall in the south wall of the nave. There is a Saxon font in the church. In the 13th century the church was rebuilt because it was in poor condition. There was a fire in the 16th century. The Faxfleet aisle was built in 1633, the money came from Henry Garway. He later became Lord Mayor of London. Mrs. Barnard donated the money for the timbered roof of the church. The Barnards did a lot for the villagers.
